bug.author: zhoonit
bug.summary: unittest_tizen_python3-* failes due to path problem.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>What happens</denchmark-h>
unittest fails <denchmark-code>[1/2] Running all tests. 1/9 unittest_common OK 0.012059926986694336 s 2/9 unittest_sink OK 21.76937747001648 s 3/9 unittest_plugins OK 0.4767441749572754 s 4/9 unittest_src_iio OK 1.4801504611968994 s 5/9 unittest_cppfilter OK 1.1800434589385986 s 6/9 unittest_tizen_custom OK 0.007698774337768555 s 7/9 unittest_tizen_custom-set OK 0.010548830032348633 s 8/9 unittest_tizen_python3-get FAIL 0.16866469383239746 s (exit status (1,)) 9/9 unittest_tizen_python3-set FAIL 0.16727900505065918 s (exit status (1,)) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>How to replicate the problem</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>rm -rf $NNST_ROOT/lib/* rm -rf $NNST_ROOT/include/* rm -rf $NNST_ROOT/bin/* rm -rf build meson --prefix=${NNST_ROOT} --sysconfdir=${NNST_ROOT} --libdir=lib --bindir=bin --includedir=include -Denable-python=true build && ninja -C build install && ninja -C build test </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Reason</denchmark-h>
tensor_filter_python.cc:250 fails to import nnstreamer_python
symlink nnstreamer_python3.so -> nnstreamer_python.so is not made(same for python2) $PYTHONPATH needs to be updated to point $NNST_BUILD_ROOT/ext/nnstreamer/tensor_filter/
which run_unittests_binaries.sh does. <denchmark-h:h2>Suggested fix to the problem</denchmark-h>
Adding meson.build test env for python2, python3 at nnstreamer_filter_extensions_common. IMO bit of refactor required. Fixing tensor_filter_python.cc should import either nnstreamer_python2 or nnstreamer_python3depending onPY_VERSION_HEX`

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/2303>#2303</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.

Fixing tensor_filter_python.cc should import either nnstreamer_python2 or nnstreamer_python3 depending on PY_VERSION_HEX
This can't be done easily because there is name of the library has to be exactly same with module name. So, I will try to fix by make a module that is compatible for both python2/3

This can't be done easily because there is name of the library has to be exactly same with module name. So, I will try to fix by make a module that is compatible for both python2/3
Handing over to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wooksong>@wooksong</denchmark-link>
I am closing this issue as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/pull/2338>#2338</denchmark-link> resolves the problem
